text: Robert Cutler (1895 â€“ 1974) was a U.S. administrator. He served as National Security Advisor between 1953 and 1955, and again from 1957 to 1958. A graduate of Harvard College and Harvard Law School and attorney and bank executive in Boston, Massachusetts before taking public office, he was the person to serve in the newly created position of National Security Advisor during the Eisenhower Administration. ==References== *"Bostonian at Work ", Time, June 4, 1953. Retrieved January 19, 2015 Category:United States National Security Advisors Category:Politicians from Boston Category:1895 births Category:1974 deaths
title: Robert Cutler
